TopicTitle: Does is possible that space stop expansion and start shrinking itself

Articles.Content: I must admit that i once watched Mr Nobody, and now wonder does is possible to space continuum start to shrink itself, and does the time start flow backward?

https://xkcd.com/1203

Space shrinking, might be. Time flow reversing, no.

In principle, yes. However all available data points to no.

As best we can tell, we're in a flat universe with a positive cosmological constant. This suggests that the universe will expand forever with the Hubble parameter increasing somewhat to a moderate constant.

It's called the Big Crunch (a la Big Bang). While it's a theory about how our universe will eventually end/life in the universe will end, the more accepted theory is that it will continue to expand until it's dark and cold; no stars, no life, no light. Just big balls of rock floating through space.

It's called the Big Crunch (a la Big Bang). While it's a theory about how our universe will eventually end/life in the universe will end, the more accepted theory is that it will continue to expand until it's dark and cold; no stars, no life, no light. Just big balls of rock floating through space.

And even after that, the protons will decay, so, nothing.
